body:
As mentioned in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/31762#issuecomment-2567073174 this adds a new option to `vim.lsp.Config`.

Problem: some language servers do not work properly without root dir

Solution: add option to disable starting language server when no root
dir is found

Fixes #31762

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
      • {workspace_required}?  (`boolean`) (default false) Server requires
                               a workspace (no "single file" support).
```

comment_regular_data.body: Agree that `single_file_support` is a poor name. I might suggest something like `root_dir_required`, `requires_root`, `root_required` etc (default: `false`).

Yeah you are right. I was using it because [neovim/nvim-lspconfig](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/709e3e87441204315fe0384a5a3c72f1a520d82c/doc/lspconfig.txt#L75) calls it that and I did not have a better name in mind.

+1 to `requires_root`

I suggest we go with @mfussenegger suggestion here https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31565#issuecomment-2541240230

> If we wanted to mirror that, lsp.enable would need a requires_workspace: boolean or something like that. So far we didn't have that concept because lsp.start didn't need it as it was kinda implicit - if the user calls it, they'd need to know that the server can handle whatever root_dir/workspaceFolder configuration the user provided.
Do you mean just changing the name to `requires_workspace` or changing how the check works?
Clients can be configured without a root_dir but with workspace folders. If there is no workspace folders then we default it to the root dir (if there is one). The new flag should allow either.

> If we wanted to mirror that, lsp.enable would need a requires_workspace: boolean or something like that

In `:help lsp` I see we have `workspace_folders` and `root_dir` fields. Is it possible for a "root dir" to exist without a "workspace folder"? If not, then `root_required` seems like the right name, to align with `root_markers` and `root_dir`. Else `workspace_required`.

> Is it possible for a "root dir" to exist without a "workspace folder"? 

Yes. If there are no configured workspace folders, then one is created automatically using the root_dir.

EDIT: sorry got this slightly wrong. We infer a root if there are configured workspace folders. Answer is still yes though.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/runtime%2Flua%2Fvim%2Flsp%2Fclient.lua#L504-L507

```lua
  if self.workspace_folders then
    root_uri = self.workspace_folders[1].uri
    root_path = vim.uri_to_fname(root_uri)
  end
```

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/43d552c56648bc3125c7509b3d708b6bf6c0c09c/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/client.lua#L504-L507

Seems like `workspace_required` is the right name. As @mfussenegger hinted :)
